intro: Ischnosiphon baenitzii, commonly known as the Baenitz's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial shrub native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces a milky latex when the stems are broken. Ischnosiphon baenitzii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
